SEARCH
Package game.interfaces

Interface LLMDialogueBehaviour

All Superinterfaces:
Behaviour
All Known Implementing Classes:
GhostBehaviour, LLMNPCDialogueBehaviour, PoetBehaviour, SeerBehaviour
public interface LLMDialogueBehaviour extends Behaviour
An interface that defines the behaviour for dialogue with a Large Language Model (LLM). This interface is used to construct prompts and interpret responses from the LLM. Implementing classes should provide specific logic for constructing prompts based on the game context and interpreting the raw text responses from the LLM into actions.

    getAction

  • Method Details

    • constructPrompt

      String constructPrompt()
      Constructs a prompt for the LLM based on the current game context. This method should be implemented to provide the specific prompt that will be sent to the LLM.
      Returns:
      a String representing the prompt to be sent to the LLM

    • interpretResponse

      LLMDialogueAction interpretResponse(String rawResponse, Actor speaker, GameMap map)
      Interprets the raw response from the LLM and wraps it into an action. This method is called after the LLM has generated a response based on the prompt.
      Parameters:
      rawResponse - The raw response string from the LLM, which may contain multiple lines.
      speaker - The actor who is speaking the dialogue.
      map - The game map where the action is performed.
      Returns:
      an instance of LLMDialogueAction that represents the dialogue action to be executed
